System.out.println(outputStrings[outputOf]);
}
[/code][/quote]

isnt that a program for compressing files…?[/quote]

I couldn’t think of a good name, and I just saw that picture of ‘you are a winrar’.

[quote=“yakman, post:4, topic:217639”]and for the random one, why dont you just do

x = (int)(Math.random() * 6) + 1; [/quote]

Didn’t know that was possible, thanks again!

Next thing I’ll be learning is reading of and writing to files, so I’ll add some kind of highscores.

item.title: Uber sexy dice game v2
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I made something like this before, but I was told to learn OOP. Well, I quit learning Java almost straight away because I lost interest in it. Yesterday I picked it up again, but I couldn’t remember anything I already had learnt. So I looked at my old dice game and realized I had to do something about my lack of OOP knowledge, so here it is: DICE GAME V2!!!111111111111 now with objects.

Tell me what I’ve done wrong.

[code]import java.util.Random;

public class diceObjects {

Random ran = new Random();

public int roll(){
	
	int x = 0;
	
	x = ran.nextInt(6) + 1;
	
	return x;
}

public static int winrar(int p1, int p2){
	
	if (p1 > p2){
		return 1;
	}
	
	if (p1 < p2){
		return 2;
	}
	
	else return 0;
}

void outputWinrar(int outputOfWinrar){
	
	if (outputOfWinrar == 1){
		System.out.println("Player one wins");
	}
	
	if (outputOfWinrar == 2){
		System.out.println("Player two wins");
	}
	
	if (outputOfWinrar == 0){
		System.out.println("It's a tie");
	}
}

}
[/code]

How I use it:

public class diceMain {
	
	public static void main(String[] args){
		
		diceObjects dice = new diceObjects();
		int a, b, c = 0, d;
		
		a = dice.roll();
		b = dice.roll();
		System.out.println(a + " " + b);
		
		c = dice.winrar(a, b);
		System.out.println(c);
		
		
		dice.outputWinrar(c);
		
	}

}

Read full topic
